title: Larix eurolepis 'Varied Direction' (Sidney Waxman, 1985) 2019 photo
description: Larix eurolepis 'Varied Direction' (Sidney Waxman, 1985) 2019 photo - Common Name: Weeping Eurorean Larch, Size: 10x10ft., Light Green, USDA Hardiness Zone 4, In Garden Bed S1 for 2.1 YEARS (Stan). Planted in 2017. A European Larch that branches erratically in all directions. Leaves are extra long and light green. Needs to be staked for height. This plant was introduced by Sidney Waxman of Connecticut University around 1985. I have planted it (2017) on a slope without any support. AKA Larix decidua 'Varied Directions' Not staked, heading down a slope. #Larix #EuroreanLarch My other photos of this plant Satellite View using Google Maps
label: Original
